meanings.definition: The process of putting something into action or motion.
meanings.sent1: The actuation of the robot was smooth and precise.
meanings.sent2: The actuation of the alarm system alerted everyone in the building.
meanings.sent3: The actuation of the dancing robot brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her actuation of the plan was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The actuation of the roller coaster made everyone scream with excitement.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to happen or occur.
meanings.sent1: The actuation of the plan led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent2: The actuation of the new policy sparked a debate among the team.
meanings.sent3: His actuation of the water balloon fight surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The actuation of change can sometimes be challenging but necessary.
meanings.sent5: The actuation of the volcano eruption was both terrifying and awe-inspiring.
